medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced a gradual onset of dull, achy epigastric pain immediately after eating a fatty meal yesterday, worsening to a higher intensity by afternoon. She has a history of intermittent epigastric pain, including similar symptoms 2 months ago, and one year prior, which resolved without intervention. The pain has remained unchanged in quality and severity since its onset. It has improved throughout the day, but she initially could not eat due to the pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Cholelithiasis, bipolar disorder currently in remission.
medical_history.family_history: Paternal grandfather had a stroke and died; father had prostate cancer and is still alive; mother is healthy.
